noun.description: The action or state of being unfaithful to a spouse or other sexual partner.
examples: her infidelity continued after her marriage
I ought not to have tolerated his infidelities

noun.description: Unbelief in a particular religion, especially Christianity.

origin: Late Middle English (in the senses lack of faith and disloyalty): from Old French infidelite or Latin infidelitas, from infidelis not faithful (see infidel).
